Source code for keplerian_simple

#!/usr/bin/env python

'''Keplerian propagator interface with SORTS++.

'''



# Keplerian orbit calculations
# 
# 2016-2017 Juha Vierinen
#
# Things to calculate:
# - How many times per day can an object be observed with EISCAT
#
# Master catalog format:
#     ID      Factor        Mass    Diameter     m/A           a       e       i     RAAN      AoP
#____[--]________[--]________[kg]_________[m]_[kg/m2]_________[km]____[--]___[deg]____[deg]____[deg]
#000000001  0.1000E+01  0.9505E+03  0.3357E+02   1.489      40580.6  0.0043    3.68   293.36   147.67
import numpy as n
import scipy.constants as c
import scipy.optimize as so
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
import h5py
from scipy.signal import argrelextrema

from base_propagator import base_propagator

import coord
#import debris
#import e3d
#import population 

GM=398600.4415e+9
t_oe=0.0
om_e=7.2921151467e-5


[docs]def gmst(mjd_UT1):
    """
    Greenwich Mean Sidereal Time (copied from Montenbruck & Gill: Satellite orbits)
    """
    frac = lambda a: a - n.floor(a)
    
    secs = 86400.0        # Seconds per day
    MJD_J2000 = 51544.5 
    # Mean Sidereal Time
    mjd_0 = n.floor(mjd_UT1)
    UT1   = secs*(mjd_UT1-mjd_0)          # [s]
    T_0   = (mjd_0  -MJD_J2000)/36525.0
    T     = (mjd_UT1-MJD_J2000)/36525.0
    
    gmst  = 24110.54841 + 8640184.812866*T_0 + \
                1.002737909350795*UT1 \
                + (0.093104-6.2e-6*T)*T*T # [s]
                
    return 2*n.pi*frac(gmst/secs) # [rad], 0..2pi




[docs]def find_Ek(mu,e,n_kaula=20):
    E=mu
    # Kaula (1966)
    for i in range(n_kaula):
        E=e*n.sin(E)+mu
    return(E)


# Simple stupid keplerian to ecef conversion. 

[docs]def kep2ecef(t,a,e,i,raan,aop,t_oe=0.0,mu0=0.0,n_kaula=20, mjd0=57084 ):
    t_e = t-t_oe

    # mean anomaly (based on mean motion around earth)
    mu=mu0+(n.sqrt(GM/(a**3.0)))*t_e
    
    E=find_Ek(mu,e,n_kaula)
    
    Omega=raan
    omega=aop    

    # true anomaly
    nu = 2.0*n.arctan2(n.sqrt(1.0+e)*n.sin(E/2.0),n.sqrt(1.0-e)*n.cos(E/2.0))
        
    # distance to central body
    r = a*(1.0-e*n.cos(E))

    o = r*n.array([n.cos(nu),n.sin(nu),0.0])
    odot = (n.sqrt(GM*a)/r)*n.array([-n.sin(E),n.sqrt(1.0-e**2.0)*n.cos(E),0.0])

    # ECI
    p0=o[0]*(n.cos(omega)*n.cos(Omega)-n.sin(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.sin(Omega)) - o[1]*(n.sin(omega)*n.cos(Omega) + n.cos(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.sin(Omega))
    p1=o[0]*(n.cos(omega)*n.sin(Omega)+n.sin(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.cos(Omega)) + o[1]*(n.cos(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.cos(Omega) - n.sin(omega)*n.sin(Omega))
    p2=o[0]*n.sin(omega)*n.sin(i) + o[1]*n.cos(omega)*n.sin(i)
    p = n.array([p0,p1,p2])

    # Doppler in ECI
    pd0=odot[0]*(n.cos(omega)*n.cos(Omega)-n.sin(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.sin(Omega)) - odot[1]*(n.sin(omega)*n.cos(Omega) + n.cos(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.sin(Omega))
    pd1=odot[0]*(n.cos(omega)*n.sin(Omega)+n.sin(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.cos(Omega)) + odot[1]*(n.cos(omega)*n.cos(i)*n.cos(Omega) - n.sin(omega)*n.sin(Omega))
    pd2=odot[0]*n.sin(omega)*n.sin(i) + odot[1]*n.cos(omega)*n.sin(i)
    pd = n.array([pd0,pd1,pd2])
    
    # Earth rotation (sign convention double checked with GEO objects)
    Re= n.zeros([3,3])

    # Earth rotation angle
    theta=gmst(mjd0 + t/86400.0)
    
    Re[0,:]=n.array([n.cos(theta),n.sin(theta),0.0])
    Re[1,:]=n.array([-n.sin(theta),n.cos(theta),0.0])
    Re[2,:]=n.array([0.0,0.0,1.0])

    omega_earth = n.array([0, 0, om_e])
    
    # ECEF coordinate
    x=n.dot(Re,p)    # pos
    xdot=n.dot(Re,pd) - n.cross(omega_earth,x) # vel
    
    return(x,xdot)


# get a point cloud representing Earth (for visualizing Earth in a fast way)

[docs]def get_earth():
    r=6300e3
    np=100
    earth=n.zeros([3,np*3])
    ang=n.linspace(0,2.0*n.pi,num=np)
    earth[0,0:np]=r*n.cos(2.0*n.pi*ang)
    earth[1,0:np]=r*n.sin(2.0*n.pi*ang)    
    earth[0,(np):(2*np)]=r*n.cos(2.0*n.pi*ang)
    earth[2,(np):(2*np)]=r*n.sin(2.0*n.pi*ang)    
    earth[1,(2*np):(3*np)]=r*n.cos(2.0*n.pi*ang)
    earth[2,(2*np):(3*np)]=r*n.sin(2.0*n.pi*ang)
    return(earth)


# Get position in ECEF at times t (seconds)
# t = time (s)
# a = mean anomaly (km)
# e = eccentricity (unitless)
# i = inclination (deg)
# raan = right ascension of the ascending node (deg)
# aop = anomaly at perigree (deg)
# mu0 = initial position (rad)

[docs]def m_get_orbit(t,a,e,inc,raan,aop,mu0=0.0,C_D=0.0,A=0.0,m=0.0,mjd0=57084,n_kaula=20):
    ecefs=n.zeros([6,len(t)])
    for ti,t in enumerate(t):
        ecef, vels = kep2ecef(t, a*1e3, e, n.pi*inc/180.0, n.pi - n.pi*raan/180.0, -n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0, n_kaula=n_kaula, mjd0=mjd0)
        ecefs[:3,ti] = ecef
        ecefs[3:,ti] = vels
    return(ecefs)


#
# find all closest passes to station with radar antenna pointing at direction
# indicated with direction vector pointing_dir
#

[docs]def get_passes(t0,t1,a,e,i,raan,aop,station,pointing_dir,mu0=0.0,plot=False):
#    print("New object %1.2f"%(a))
    t=t0
    dt=600.0
    prev_angle=1e99
    beam_angles=[]
    crossings_t=[]
    crossings_angles=[]    
    crossings_pos=[]
    crossings_dist=[]
    crossings_range_rate=[]    
    crossings_el=[]        
    tv=[]        
    while t < t1:
        p=kep2ecef(t, a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
        tv.append(t)
        pos_vec_tx=-station+p
        stat_dist=n.sqrt(n.dot(station-p[:],station-p[:]))/1e3
        elevation_tx=90.0-angle_deg(station, pos_vec_tx)
        beam_angle=n.abs(angle_deg(pointing_dir, pos_vec_tx))
        beam_angles.append(beam_angle)
        t+=dt
        
    min_idx=argrelextrema(n.array(beam_angles), n.less)[0]
    beam_angles=n.array(beam_angles)
    tv=n.array(tv)    
    
    for mi in min_idx:
        t=tv[mi]
        t_low = t - dt 
        t_high = t + dt 
        beam_angle_h=1e99
        tmean=0.5*(t_low+t_high)
        for it_i in range(50): # about 1e-4 second accuracy for peak transit. good enough
            p=kep2ecef(t_high, a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
            stat_dist=n.sqrt(n.dot(station-p,station-p))/1e3 # length from p_prev to p
            pos_vec_tx=-station+p
            beam_angle_h=n.abs(angle_deg(pointing_dir, pos_vec_tx))

            p=kep2ecef(0.5*(t_high+t_low), a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
            stat_dist=n.sqrt(n.dot(station-p,station-p))/1e3 # length from p_prev to p
            pos_vec_tx=-station+p
            beam_angle_m=n.abs(angle_deg(pointing_dir, pos_vec_tx))
            
            p=kep2ecef(t_low, a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
            pos_vec_tx=-station+p
            beam_angle_l=n.abs(angle_deg(pointing_dir, pos_vec_tx))

            t_lmh=n.array([t_low,0.5*(t_low+t_high),t_high])
            tmp_beam_angles=n.array([beam_angle_l,beam_angle_m,beam_angle_h])
            tmean=t_lmh[n.argmin(tmp_beam_angles)]
            if plot:
                print("beam_angle %1.2f dt %1.2f t0 %1.2f"%(beam_angle_m,t_high-t_low,tmean))
            t_high = tmean+0.4*(t_high-t_low)
            t_low = tmean-0.4*(t_high-t_low)            
                
        if beam_angle_m < 20.0:
            elevation=90.0-angle_deg(station,pos_vec_tx)
            p=kep2ecef(tmean, a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
            stat_dist0=n.sqrt(n.dot(station-p,station-p))/1e3 # length from p_prev to p
            p=kep2ecef(tmean+1.0, a*1e3, e, n.pi*i/180.0, n.pi*raan/180.0, n.pi*aop/180.0, mu0=mu0)
            stat_dist1=n.sqrt(n.dot(station-p,station-p))/1e3 # length from p_prev to p
            range_rate=(stat_dist1-stat_dist0)/1.0
            
            crossings_el.append(elevation)
            crossings_t.append(tmean)
            crossings_angles.append(beam_angle_m)                
            crossings_pos.append(p)
            crossings_range_rate.append(range_rate)            
            crossings_dist.append(stat_dist)
    if (len(min_idx) > 0) and plot:
        print(min_idx)
        plt.plot(tv,beam_angles,color="lightblue")
        plt.plot(crossings_t,crossings_angles,"x",color="black")
        print(crossings_t)
        print(crossings_angles)        
        plt.show()

    return(crossings_t,crossings_angles,crossings_pos,crossings_dist,crossings_el,crossings_range_rate)

[docs]def plot_orbits():
    m=master.get_master()
    print(m.shape)
    
    np=1000
    t=n.linspace(0.0,24.0*3600.0,num=np)

    for i in range(1000):
        print(m[i,:])
        ecefs=get_orbit(t,m[i,5],m[i,6],m[i,7],m[i,8],m[i,9])
        fig = plt.figure()
        ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')
        ax.plot(ecefs[0,:], ecefs[1,:], ecefs[2,:],".")
        plt.title("Orbit in ECEF, a=%1.2f km e=%1.3f i=%1.2f"%(m[i,5],m[i,6],m[i,7]))
#        ax.set_xlim([-40000e3,40000e3])
 #       ax.set_ylim([-40000e3,40000e3])
  #      ax.set_zlim([-40000e3,40000e3])        
        plt.show()
        plt.close()



[docs]def plot_alt():
    m=master.get_master()
    print(m.shape)
    
    np=1000
    t=n.linspace(0.0,24.0*3600.0,num=np)
    r_e=6371e3
    for i in range(1000):
        print(m[i,:])
        ecefs=get_orbit(t,m[i,5],m[i,6],m[i,7],m[i,8],m[i,9])
        alt=(n.sqrt(ecefs[0,:]**2.0+ecefs[1,:]**2.0+ecefs[2,:]**2.0)-r_e)/1e3
        plt.clf()
        plt.plot(alt)
        plt.show()



[docs]def angle_deg(a,b):
    return(180.0*n.arccos(n.dot(a,b)/(n.sqrt(n.dot(a,a))*n.sqrt(n.dot(b,b))))/n.pi)


        

[docs]def test_kaula():
    a=7108.7
    e=0.0043
    i=70.94
    raan=85.81
    aop=81.96
    t=n.linspace(0.0,24.0*3600.0,num=100.0)
    ecefs0=get_orbit(t,a, e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234,n_kaula=200)
    ecefs1=get_orbit(t,a, e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234,n_kaula=10)
    ecefs2=get_orbit(t,a, e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234,n_kaula=20)
    diff_1=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs1[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs1[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs1[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_2=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs2[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs2[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs2[2,:])**2.0)
    plt.plot(diff_1,".")
    plt.plot(diff_2,".")
    plt.show()


        

[docs]def test_diffs(da=1e-3,de=-0.0006,di=1e-3,dOm=1e-3,dom=1e-3,dmu=1e-5):
    a=7108.7
    e=0.0001
    i=70.94
    raan=85.81
    aop=81.96
    t=n.linspace(0.0,24.0*3600.0,num=100.0)
    ecefs0=get_orbit(t,a, e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234)
    ecefs_da=get_orbit(t,a+da,e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234)
    ecefs_de=get_orbit(t,a,e+de,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234)
    ecefs_di=get_orbit(t,a,e,i+di,raan,aop,mu0=1.234)    
    ecefs_dOm=get_orbit(t,a,e,i,raan+dOm,aop,mu0=1.234)
    ecefs_dom=get_orbit(t,a,e,i,raan,aop+dom,mu0=1.234)
    ecefs_dmu=get_orbit(t,a,e,i,raan,aop,mu0=1.234+dmu)                    
    #     ID      Factor        Mass    Diameter     m/A           a       e       i     RAAN      AoP
    #____[--]________[--]________[kg]_________[m]_[kg/m2]_________[km]____[--]___[deg]____[deg]____[deg]
    #    000000006  0.1000E+01  0.2305E+04  0.2745E+02   5.406       7375.3  0.0225   98.73    46.90    86.43
    diff_a=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_da[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_da[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_da[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_e=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_de[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_de[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_de[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_i=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_di[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_di[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_di[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_O=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_dOm[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_dOm[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_dOm[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_o=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_dom[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_dom[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_dom[2,:])**2.0)
    diff_m=n.sqrt((ecefs0[0,:]-ecefs_dmu[0,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[1,:]-ecefs_dmu[1,:])**2.0+(ecefs0[2,:]-ecefs_dmu[2,:])**2.0)    
    
    plt.subplot(611)
    plt.plot(diff_a,".")
    plt.subplot(612)
    plt.plot(diff_e,".")
    plt.subplot(613)
    plt.plot(diff_i,".")
    plt.subplot(614)
    plt.plot(diff_O,".")
    plt.subplot(615)
    plt.plot(diff_o,".")
    plt.subplot(616)
    plt.plot(diff_m,".")
    plt.show()

        
        
    
    

        
if __name__ == "__main__":
    t=n.linspace(0,4*3600.0,num=10000)

    mjd0=2457126.2729

    import time
    t0=time.time()
    ecefs=get_orbit(t,a=7000,e=0.0,inc=90.0,raan=10,aop=10.0,mu0=40.0,mjd0=mjd0)
    t1=time.time()
    
    print(1e6*(t1-t0)/10000.0)
                  
    print(ecefs.shape)
    plt.plot(n.sqrt(n.diff(ecefs[0,:])**2.0+n.diff(ecefs[1,:])**2.0+n.diff(ecefs[2,:])**2.0)/1e3)
    plt.ylim([0,20])    
    plt.title("Diff")
    plt.show()
    
    
    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,15))
    ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')
    ax.plot(ecefs[0,:], ecefs[1,:], ecefs[2,:],".",color="green")
    ax.set_xlim([-10000e3,10000e3])
    ax.set_ylim([-10000e3,10000e3])
    ax.set_zlim([-10000e3,10000e3])        
    
    plt.show()



[docs]class simple_propagator(base_propagator):
    def __init__(self):
        base_propagator.__init__(self,'kep') 
        print("init simple")


[docs]    def get_orbit(self,t,a,e,inc,raan,aop,mu0,mjd0=2457126.2729,A=1,m=1e3,C_D=2.3):
        return(m_get_orbit(t,a,e,inc,raan,aop,mu0,mjd0=mjd0,A=A,m=m,C_D=C_D))

    
    def __enter__(self):
        return self

    def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback):
        pass
